meanings.definition: The state or quality of being absorbent.
meanings.sent1: The absorbancies of the sponge made it perfect for cleaning up spills.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's absorbancies allowed it to quickly soak up the water.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had incredible absorbancies, making it impossible for any liquid to stain it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had an absorbancies for knowledge, always eager to learn new things.
meanings.sent5: The desert sand's absorbancies of heat made it scorching to walk on during the day.

meanings.definition: The ability to soak up or take in something.
meanings.sent1: The paper towel's absorbancies were evident when it absorbed the spilled juice.
meanings.sent2: Plants have natural absorbancies that help them take in water and nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The sponge's absorbancies were so strong that it even soaked up all the spilled milk from the floor.
meanings.sent4: His absorbancies for new ideas made him a great innovator in the field.
meanings.sent5: The sponge's absorbancies were so impressive that it could soak up an entire cup of water in seconds.

meanings.definition: The capacity to absorb or assimilate something.
meanings.sent1: The absorbancies of the soil determined how well it could absorb nutrients for the plants.
meanings.sent2: The human body's absorbancies of vitamins and minerals are crucial for maintaining health.
meanings.sent3: The absorbancies of the student for new information were truly remarkable.
meanings.sent4: The absorbancies of the organization for change helped it adapt quickly to new market trends.
meanings.sent5: The absorbancies of the sponge were so high that it could absorb a large amount of liquid without leaking.
